content:
Diagnosis:		Malignant gastrinoma of pancreatic head

Staging:		Stage IIB (T3N1M0) with regional lymph node involvement

Treatment:		15 Jan 2024 Whipple's procedure
			1 Feb - 15 Apr 2024 Adjuvant capecitabine

Histology:		Well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor, Ki67 8%

Current Status:	End of treatment review
?
[redacted name] has completed the planned 3-month course of adjuvant capecitabine following Whipple's procedure for gastrinoma. The treatment was generally well tolerated with only grade 1 hand-foot syndrome which has now resolved.
?
Serum gastrin has normalized from pre-operative level of 1200 pg/mL to current 85 pg/mL. Recent CT shows no evidence of residual or recurrent disease. Performance status remains excellent at ECOG 0.
?
The plan is for 3-monthly surveillance with gastrin levels and imaging at 6 months. I have provided written information about surveillance schedule and symptoms to watch for. We will review again in clinic in 3 months with blood results.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: gastrin 1200 pg/mL pre-operatively, normalized to 85 pg/mL

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows no evidence of residual or recurrent disease
Completed planned 3-month course of adjuvant capecitabine

patient_facts.value: CT shows no evidence of residual or recurrent disease

status_updates.value: Stage IIB pancreatic gastrinoma treated with surgery and adjuvant chemotherapy. Now completed treatment with normalized tumor markers and no evidence of disease.
Grade 1 hand-foot syndrome which has now resolved
Completed planned 3-month course of adjuvant capecitabine
3-monthly surveillance with gastrin levels and imaging at 6 months
Review in clinic in 3 months with blood results
